Sentencas: The production of green hydrogen is currently facing a challenge due to its growing role as a chemical intermediate or energy vector.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: Thus, it is unsurprising that there is a strong interest in improving current technologies and developing new approaches to reduce energy demand for producing pure H2.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: Taking advantage of the thermodynamic characteristics of solid oxide electrochemical cells, we devised a new cell that could simultaneously reduce water and oxidize bioethanol, and as a result to achieve green hydrogen at very low electric power energy consumption.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: This approach was demonstrated by developing a symmetrical electrolyte-supported cell.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: The selected electrolyte was LSGM, which showed interesting conductive properties and was free of electronic leaks.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: An exsolved perovskite in combination with doped ceria (i.e. LSCN-CGO) was selected for cathode and anode for its promising electrocatalytic and redox properties.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: This cell demonstrated excellent stability over 450 h of testing and an excellent power-saving operation at a current density of 0.8 A cm-2 at 0.25 V. Results of the physico-chemical measurements evidenced a very stable morphology and very interesting redox properties of the investigated materials composing the cell.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water

Sentencas: Considering these characteristics and the negligible amount of carbon observed in the anode, the complete perovskite designed as LSCN-CGO/LSGM/LSCN-CGO is promising for producing green H2 with the aid of bioethanol.
Titulo: Exploring the use of bioethanol for high-temperature electrolysis of water
